meanings.definition: To remove a load or burden from a vehicle or ship.
meanings.sent1: The workers offloaded the heavy boxes from the truck.
meanings.sent2: The sailors offloaded the cargo from the ship at the port.
meanings.sent3: After a long journey, the truck finally offloaded its cargo, feeling relieved.
meanings.sent4: She offloaded her worries like a heavy backpack, feeling lighter.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crane offloading the containers was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To transfer responsibility or work to someone else.
meanings.sent1: The manager offloaded the project onto his team members.
meanings.sent2: Parents often offload household chores to their children.
meanings.sent3: The lazy student tried to offload his homework onto his friend.
meanings.sent4: She offloaded her stress onto her therapist during the session.
meanings.sent5: The teacher offloaded the task of organizing the class party to the students.

meanings.definition: To sell or dispose of goods or assets.
meanings.sent1: The company offloaded its old inventory at a discount.
meanings.sent2: They decided to offload their unused furniture before moving.
meanings.sent3: He offloaded his old comic book collection at a garage sale.
meanings.sent4: She offloaded her vintage clothes to a thrift store.
meanings.sent5: The farmer offloaded his surplus produce at the market.
